trans-unit.source: Explains how to replace a disk drive on a StorSimple primary device or an EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: Explains how to replace a disk drive on a StorSimple primary device or an EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: Replace a disk drive on your StorSimple device
trans-unit.target: Replace a disk drive on your StorSimple device

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how you can remove and replace a malfunctioning or failed hard disk drive on a Microsoft Azure StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how you can remove and replace a malfunctioning or failed hard disk drive on a Microsoft Azure StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: To replace a disk drive, you need to:
trans-unit.target: To replace a disk drive, you need to:

trans-unit.source: Disengage the antitamper lock
trans-unit.target: Disengage the antitamper lock

trans-unit.source: Remove the disk drive
trans-unit.target: Remove the disk drive

trans-unit.source: Install the replacement disk drive
trans-unit.target: Install the replacement disk drive

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Before removing and replacing a disk drive, review the safety information in [StorSimple hardware component replacement](storsimple-hardware-component-replacement.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Before removing and replacing a disk drive, review the safety information in [StorSimple hardware component replacement](storsimple-hardware-component-replacement.md).

trans-unit.source: Disengage the antitamper lock
trans-unit.target: Disengage the antitamper lock

trans-unit.source: This procedure explains how the antitamper locks on your StorSimple device can be engaged or disengaged when you replace the disk drives.
trans-unit.target: This procedure explains how the antitamper locks on your StorSimple device can be engaged or disengaged when you replace the disk drives.

trans-unit.source: The antitamper locks are fitted in the drive carrier handles, and they are accessed through a small aperture in the latch section of the handle.
trans-unit.target: The antitamper locks are fitted in the drive carrier handles, and they are accessed through a small aperture in the latch section of the handle.

trans-unit.source: Drives are supplied with the locks set to the locked position.
trans-unit.target: Drives are supplied with the locks set to the locked position.

trans-unit.source: To unlock the antitamper lock
trans-unit.target: To unlock the antitamper lock

trans-unit.source: Carefully insert the lock key (a "tamperproof" T10 screwdriver that Microsoft provided) into the aperture in the handle and into its socket.
trans-unit.target: Carefully insert the lock key (a "tamperproof" T10 screwdriver that Microsoft provided) into the aperture in the handle and into its socket.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If the antitamper lock is activated, the red indicator is visible in the aperture.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If the antitamper lock is activated, the red indicator is visible in the aperture.

trans-unit.target: Rotate the key in an anticlockwise direction until the red indicator is not visible in the aperture above the key.

trans-unit.target: The disk drive can now be removed.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps in reverse to engage the lock.

trans-unit.source: Remove the disk drive
trans-unit.target: Remove the disk drive

trans-unit.source: Your StorSimple device supports a RAID 10–like storage spaces configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your StorSimple device supports a RAID 10–like storage spaces configuration.

trans-unit.source: This implies that it can operate normally with one failed disk, solid-state drive (SSD), or hard disk drive (HDD).
trans-unit.target: This implies that it can operate normally with one failed disk, solid-state drive (SSD), or hard disk drive (HDD).

trans-unit.source: If your system has more than one failed disk, do not remove more than one SSD or HDD from the system at any point in time.
trans-unit.target: If your system has more than one failed disk, do not remove more than one SSD or HDD from the system at any point in time.

trans-unit.source: Doing so could result in loss of data.
trans-unit.target: Doing so could result in loss of data.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you place a replacement SSD in a slot that previously contained an SSD.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you place a replacement SSD in a slot that previously contained an SSD.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, place a replacement HDD in a slot that previously contained an HDD.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, place a replacement HDD in a slot that previously contained an HDD.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, slots are numbered from 0 – 11.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, slots are numbered from 0 – 11.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, if the portal shows that a disk in slot 2 has failed, on the device, look for the failed disk in the third slot from the top left.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, if the portal shows that a disk in slot 2 has failed, on the device, look for the failed disk in the third slot from the top left.

trans-unit.source: Drives can be removed and replaced while the system is operating.
trans-unit.target: Drives can be removed and replaced while the system is operating.

trans-unit.source: To remove a drive
trans-unit.target: To remove a drive

trans-unit.source: To identify the failed disk, in the Management Portal, navigate to **Devices** > **Maintenance** > **Hardware Status**.
trans-unit.target: To identify the failed disk, in the Management Portal, navigate to **Devices** > **Maintenance** > **Hardware Status**.

trans-unit.source: Because a disk can fail in the primary enclosure and/or in an EBOD enclosure (if you are using a 8600 model), look at the status of the disks under **Shared Components** and under **EBOD enclosure Shared Components**.
trans-unit.target: Because a disk can fail in the primary enclosure and/or in an EBOD enclosure (if you are using a 8600 model), look at the status of the disks under **Shared Components** and under **EBOD enclosure Shared Components**.

trans-unit.source: A failed disk in either enclosure will be shown with a red status.
trans-unit.target: A failed disk in either enclosure will be shown with a red status.

trans-unit.source: Locate the drives in the front of the primary enclosure or the EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: Locate the drives in the front of the primary enclosure or the EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: For the failed disk, the amber LED will be lit.
trans-unit.target: For the failed disk, the amber LED will be lit.

trans-unit.source: If the disk is unlocked, proceed to the next step.
trans-unit.target: If the disk is unlocked, proceed to the next step.

trans-unit.source: If the disk is locked, unlock it by following the procedure in [Disengage the antitamper lock](#disengage-the-antitamper-lock).
trans-unit.target: If the disk is locked, unlock it by following the procedure in [Disengage the antitamper lock](#disengage-the-antitamper-lock).

trans-unit.source: Press the black latch on the drive carrier module and pull the drive carrier handle out and away from the front of the chassis.
trans-unit.target: Press the black latch on the drive carrier module and pull the drive carrier handle out and away from the front of the chassis.

trans-unit.source: When the drive carrier handle is fully extended, slide the drive carrier out of the chassis.
trans-unit.target: When the drive carrier handle is fully extended, slide the drive carrier out of the chassis.

trans-unit.source: Install the replacement disk drive
trans-unit.target: Install the replacement disk drive

trans-unit.source: After a drive has failed in your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device and you have removed it, follow this procedure to replace it with a new drive.
trans-unit.target: After a drive has failed in your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device and you have removed it, follow this procedure to replace it with a new drive.

trans-unit.source: To insert a drive
trans-unit.target: To insert a drive

trans-unit.source: Ensure the drive carrier handle is fully extended, as shown in the following image.
trans-unit.target: Ensure the drive carrier handle is fully extended, as shown in the following image.

trans-unit.source: Disk drive with handle extended
trans-unit.target: Disk drive with handle extended

trans-unit.source: **Figure 5** Drive with handle extended
trans-unit.target: **Figure 5** Drive with handle extended

trans-unit.source: Slide the drive carrier all the way into the chassis.
trans-unit.target: Slide the drive carrier all the way into the chassis.

trans-unit.source: Sliding disk into disk drive carrier
trans-unit.target: Sliding disk into disk drive carrier

trans-unit.source: **Figure 6** Sliding the drive carrier into the chassis
trans-unit.target: **Figure 6** Sliding the drive carrier into the chassis

trans-unit.source: With the drive carrier inserted, close the drive carrier handle while continuing to push the drive carrier into the chassis, until the drive carrier handle snaps into a locked position.
trans-unit.target: With the drive carrier inserted, close the drive carrier handle while continuing to push the drive carrier into the chassis, until the drive carrier handle snaps into a locked position.

trans-unit.source: Use the lock key that was provided by Microsoft (tamperproof Torx screwdriver) to secure the carrier handle into place by turning the lock screw a quarter turn clockwise.
trans-unit.target: Use the lock key that was provided by Microsoft (tamperproof Torx screwdriver) to secure the carrier handle into place by turning the lock screw a quarter turn clockwise.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the replacement was successful and the drive is operational by accessing the Management Portal and navigating to **Maintenance** > **Hardware Status**.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the replacement was successful and the drive is operational by accessing the Management Portal and navigating to **Maintenance** > **Hardware Status**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Shared Components** or **EBOD enclosure Shared Components**, the drive status should be green, indicating that it is healthy.
trans-unit.target: Under **Shared Components** or **EBOD enclosure Shared Components**, the drive status should be green, indicating that it is healthy.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] It may take several hours for the disk status to turn green after the replacement.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] It may take several hours for the disk status to turn green after the replacement.
